ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about different types of screens and strengthened my abilities to read and comprehend scientific papers.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
strength - the breadth of lectures
weakness - receiving feedback on assignments, getting grades back in a timely manner

I certainly understand that this course is intended primarily for graduate students. That being said, since undergrads such as myself generally have to take this course for a letter grade, it would be nice if our assignments were graded with a little bit more regularity, so that we can learn/improve as we go, instead of reviewing it all post facto.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: no - I did not receive any grades back until close to the end of the semester, making it impossible to improve my performance on assignments. this course was poorly organized and should not be offered to undergraduate students if faculty members cannot provide any feedback whatsoever.
